borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed development will result in an unacceptable impact on the living conditions of the neighbouring property No. 312 Hedgemans Road with regard to an unacceptable sense of overbearing and enclosure within the rear garden. Therefore the development is contrary to:</p><p>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework Borough Wide Development Plan (March 2011)<br>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, June 2020)<br>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012).</p>

<p><span style="line-height: 107%;">The proposed development fails to respect the character and appearance of the area, w</span>ith the proposed additions being unsympathetic and&nbsp;uncharacteristic of the original dwelling house, the terrace and the wider <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Becontree" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="kgi71y4pxzh0tk0gb" style="">Becontree</span> Estate, significantly&nbsp;altering the symmetry, balance and built form of the&nbsp;original dwelling and terrace within the street scene. The development will significantly reduce the gap between the host property and the neighbouring dwelling, No.312 <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Hedgemans" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="kgi71y8dm05u0d0ix" style="">Hedgemans</span> Road, reducing an important architectural break, prominent when viewed from <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Lullington" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="kgi72s4oyxxb8vzsj" style="">Lullington</span>&nbsp;Road. The development&nbsp;is worsened by the introduction of a gable end roof form, harmful to the <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Becontree" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="kgi71y8ctjmucl56w" style="">Becontree</span> Estate. The proposed ground floor bedroom does not meet the needs of the homeowners and relies on two small obscure glazed windows for daylight which is insufficient. Therefore the development is contrary to:&nbsp;<span arial="" style="">&nbsp;</span><br></p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br>- Policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies HC1, D1 and D4 of the Draft London Plan (December 2019)<br>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010),<br>- Policies BP2, BP5 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies SPP6, SP2, DMD1, DMD6 and DMD4 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, June 2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)</p>
description: Construction of Part single part two  storey side extension and construction of a Hip-to-gable roof extension to accommodate a rear dormer extension including three roof lights to the front and a Juliette balcony.
